goals.question: What is the distribution of daily returns for the S&P 500 index?
goals.rationale: This visualization can help us understand the volatility of the S&P 500 index and identify any potential outliers.

goals.question: What is the correlation between the S&P 500 index and the NASDAQ index?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of S&P 500 index vs NASDAQ index
goals.rationale: This visualization can help us understand the relationship between the two indices and identify any potential patterns or trends.

goals.question: What is the trend of the S&P 500 index over time?
goals.visualization: Line chart of S&P 500 index over time
goals.rationale: This visualization can help us understand the overall performance of the S&P 500 index and identify any potential long-term trends.

goals.question: What is the distribution of trading volumes for the S&P 500 index?
goals.rationale: This visualization can help us understand the liquidity of the S&P 500 index and identify any potential outliers.

goals.question: What is the distribution of daily changes in the S&P 500 index?
goals.rationale: This visualization can help us understand the variability of daily changes in the S&P 500 index and identify any potential outliers or trends.

code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['Date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['Date'], errors='coerce')
    data = data[pd.notna(data['Date'])]
    data['Daily_Return'] = data['Close'].pct_change()
    data = data.dropna()

    plt.hist(data['Daily_Return'], bins=50, color='blue', alpha=0.7, label='Daily Returns')
    plt.axvline(data['Daily_Return'].median(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=2, label=f"Median: {data['Daily_Return'].median():.2f}")
    plt.xlabel('Daily Returns')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of daily returns for the S&P 500 index?', wrap=True)
    plt.legend()
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['Date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['Date'], errors='coerce')
    data = data[pd.notna(data['Date'])]

    plt.scatter(data['S&P 500'], data['NASDAQ'], label='S&P 500 vs NASDAQ')
    plt.xlabel('S&P 500 Index')
    plt.ylabel('NASDAQ Index')
    plt.title('What is the correlation between the S&P 500 index and the NASDAQ index?', wrap=True)
    plt.legend()
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['Date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['Date'], errors='coerce')
    data = data[pd.notna(data['Date'])]
    
    plt.plot(data['Date'], data['Close'], label='S&P 500 Index')
    plt.xlabel('Date')
    plt.ylabel('Close')
    plt.title('What is the trend of the S&P 500 index over time?', wrap=True)
    plt.legend()
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['Date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['Date'], errors='coerce')
    data = data[pd.notna(data['Date'])]
    
    plt.hist(data['Volume'], bins=50, color='blue', alpha=0.7)
    plt.axvline(data['Volume'].median(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=2, label=f"Median: {data['Volume'].median():.2f}")
    plt.xlabel('Trading Volume')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of trading volumes for the S&P 500 index?', wrap=True)
    plt.legend()
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['Date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['Date'], errors='coerce')
    data = data[pd.notna(data['Date'])]
    data['Daily_Change'] = data['Close'].diff()
    
    fig, ax = plt.subplots()
    ax.boxplot(data['Daily_Change'].dropna(), vert=False)
    ax.set_xlabel('Daily Change')
    ax.set_yticklabels(['S&P 500'])
    plt.title('What is the distribution of daily changes in the S&P 500 index?', wrap=True)
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
